title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics defeat Bulls 124-105, with Nikola Vucevic scoring 19 points and grabbing 11 rebounds.
Jordan Walsh delivered a strong performance with 16 points, six rebounds, three steals, and two blocks.
Payton Pritchard contributed 26 points, maintaining efficiency with a low turnover rate during blowout victory.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man in the Boston area, has been held in ICE detention in El Paso, Texas for five months.
Culleton, who overstayed his visa in 2009, is married to a U.S. citizen and has a pending green card application.
ICE rescinded Culleton's bail after it was posted, and he describes poor conditions in detention; DHS denies these claims.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs' future with the Patriots is uncertain due to his $20.6 million non-guaranteed salary for 2026.
Releasing Diggs before June 1 could save the Patriots $16.8 million, increasing to $20.8 million with a post-June 1 release.
Diggs faces legal issues, including assault charges and a pending lawsuit, but the Patriots have expressed support for him.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard fire and police crews rescued a dog named Rufus from Mill Pond after it fell through ice at 9 p.m.
A drone was used by police to guide fire crews, resulting in Rufus being rescued within ten minutes.
Rufus suffered no serious injuries and returned home safely; the rescue video was shared by the Maynard Fire Department.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused delays up to 50 minutes on all 12 commuter rail lines Wednesday, MBTA reports.
Over 25 commuter rail trains were canceled Wednesday due to ongoing signal problems, MBTA states.
Blue Line shuttle buses operated from Orient Heights to Wonderland due to a resolved power issue.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj found guilty of assault and battery on a police officer; acquitted of interfering charge.
Haxhiaj sentenced to six months probation and 40 hours of community service.
Incident occurred during an ICE arrest; Haxhiaj accused of shoving officer Shauna McGuirk.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue's new lounge at Logan Airport, BlueHouse BOS, will open this summer in Terminal C near gate C23.
The Boston lounge spans 11,000 square feet, nearly 40% larger than its 8,000-square-foot counterpart at JFK Airport.
Amenities include complimentary food, beverages, a full-service bar, private workspaces with free WiFi, and unique Boston-themed experiences.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN predicts Patriots will use their first-round pick on offensive tackle Caleb Lomu from the University of Utah.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled in their Super Bowl LX loss, highlighting a need for stronger protection for QB Drake Maye.
Coach Mike Vrabel supports current left tackle Will Campbell, but Lomu could offer versatility as a tackle or guard.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin joins the Boston Red Sox and is inspired by former MVP Dustin Pedroia's playing style.
Durbin is expected to compete for infield spots, contributing strong defense and low strikeout rates.
Acquired from the Brewers, Durbin hit 11 home runs with a .387 slugging percentage in 2025.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown advised Patriots quarterback Drake Maye to use the Super Bowl loss as motivation to improve.
Brown shared his own experiences of championship losses, emphasizing the importance of resilience and maintaining passion.
Brown encouraged Maye to focus on self-belief and personal growth following Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl defeat.
